content:
So I was going through some older issues and found an issue (opened a PR for the same).

As this comment states, is it helpful to add the PM buttons to the user profile modal?

Need opinions on this.

Thank you!
Probably makes sense for @Alya Abbott to take a look at the issue, since we've done a bunch of changes to plans for the user profile since that issue was opened.
I'm the one who left the comment. ;)
Anyway, broader feedback is appreciated; I'll move this to a more approriate stream.
This topic was moved here from #frontend > Add PM buttons to user profile modal. by Alya Abbott.

When I view my user profile, there's a little edit profile icon next to my name. Could we just add a similar icon / link to other people's user profiles that goes to the private/direct message narrow with that person?

Screenshot-from-2023-01-25-15-19-59.png

And we could drop adding a link to send a private message because the default behavior of the compose box when navigating to a private/direct message narrow seems fine here:

  • if the compose box is open with some draft text, leave it as is
  • if the compose box is closed/empty, then open to start composing a message to the user
Hm, that might work. I wonder if the envelope icon would be sufficiently clear by itself there (though of course we can have a tooltip).

I don't think it's super important to have a way to get to PMs with the user from the profile; most ways that one can open the profile involve passing through the user card anyway. So I think a small "Go to PMs with this user" icon (which will also as a side effect open the compose box) with some icon in that location seems pretty reasonable.
Since you could be on top of a settings view while seeing this, a "send a PM" button may not have a compose box to open.

Alya Abbott Tim Abbott Lauryn Menard Would something like this work?

PM-button.gif

I haven't styled the icon yet (with respect to the name). We can continue if this functionality (of having a PM button beside the name), serve the purpose.
I think the size and spacing are wrong, but yes the choice of icon itself seems fine.

Updated the PR.

Screenshots -

pm-icon-1.png

pm-icon-2.png

Have also updated the PR description and uploaded some GIFs.
@Sameep Aher do we need the "go to private messages with yourself" option in your own full profile? I think it might be cleaner to only ever have one icon there.
Yeah, I was debating that question... We do show that option in the user card, but it's not likely to be frequently used, so I'd be OK with being a bit inconsistent and skipping it.
Sorry, I don't think the button in the title is great, but can't suggest a solid alternative for now. I would suggest to have those buttons with text labels somewhere in the card... or under a photo

Tim Abbott said:

Sameep Aher do we need the "go to private messages with yourself" option in your own full profile? I think it might be cleaner to only ever have one icon there.

Yup, makes sense to me.

Vlad Korobov said:

Sorry, I don't think the button in the title is great, but can't suggest a solid alternative for now. I would suggest to have those buttons with text labels somewhere in the card... or under a photo

Sure, will consider this.

Considering this, these are the visuals of adding the PM buttons with text labels under the user avatar -

1) Wider screens -

pm-buttons-1.png pm-buttons-2.png

2) Small width (mobile) screens -

pm-buttons-3.png pm-buttons-4.png
I've updated the PR with the PM buttons with text labels under the photo. Please take a look. Thanks!
